titleStmt.title: T. J. Dillehay to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6218

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To his Excellency the Governor of Kentucky

Your Petitioner T J Dillahay states in the year 1862 he became the surety of one Joseph Hughs f in the penalty of $100 -- for his appearance as a witness in the Lincoln Circuit Court at the succeeding term of that Court he states soon thereafter the said Hughs joined the army of the U S Government & remained therein for about two years He states at the sept term 1864 of said Court said bond was forfeited & at the March Term 1865 a Judgment was rendered against him for $100 -- He states after the said Hughs left the army he could not find him he went off & this Petitioner could not secure his attendance as a witness This Petitioner did all he could to secure his attendance but failed He asks your Excellency to remit said Judgment
subscribed & sworn to before me by T J Dillahay this March 18 1865
We join in the prayer of the within Petition

Fon T Fox.
T. P. Young
Jno. S. Vanwinkle
R W. Graham
H. B. Edlin
M. J. Dunham

Lincoln Cir Ct
vs
T. J. Dillehay
$100.
Remitted
21st Mch/65
